item.title: Burden of proof
item.description:
Have you ever been in a debate where someone throws out a wild claim without a shred of evidence? Annoying, right? Thatâ€™s where understanding the mental model of Burden of proof comes in. It’s a powerful tool for critical thinking and clear communication, helping you navigate arguments, evaluate claims, and avoid getting bogged down in unfalsifiable statements.

1. What is Burden of Proof? #

The Burden of proof is the principle that whoever makes a claim has the responsibility to provide evidence supporting it. Simply put, if you make an assertion, the onus is on you to prove it, not on others to disprove it. It’s not enough to just say something is true; you need to back it up.
